items.title: Israel will ban dozens of aid groups from Gaza starting on New Year's Day
items.summary_auto: Israel is banning more than two dozen humanitarian organizations from Gaza for failing to comply with new registration rules.

items.title: Quebec real estate developer arrested in Martinique after over 2 months on the run
items.summary_auto: Jean-François Malo, from Joliette, Que., was convicted of ordering a 2020 armed assault on a lawyer. Radio-Canada confirmed the news of Tuesday’s arrest following an initial report by Le Journal de Montréal.

items.title: Meta just acquired a Chinese-founded AI startup for $2B. Here's why that matters
items.summary_auto: A darling of the artificial intelligence startup scene was just acquired by Meta — capping off a year of intense competition between U.S. tech giants vying for dominance of the world's most coveted technology.

items.title: Tatiana Schlossberg, granddaughter of the late John F. Kennedy, dead at 35
items.summary_auto: Environmental journalist Tatiana Schlossberg, the granddaughter of the late U.S. president John F. Kennedy, has died. She was 35. The environmental journalist revealed in November that she had acute myeloid leukemia

items.title: Green Party settles with commission over exclusion from federal leaders' debate
items.summary_auto: The federal Leaders' Debates Commission says it has settled with the Green Party after the party vowed to challenge its removal from the spring election debates.

items.title: Patriots wide receiver Stefon Diggs facing strangulation, assault charges
items.summary_auto: New England Patriots star wide receiver Stefon Diggs is facing strangulation and other criminal charges in connection with a dispute with his former private chef, police said.

items.title: More artists cancel Kennedy Center performances after Trump's name added to the building
items.summary_auto: Jazz supergroup The Cookers have cancelled their New Year's Eve performance at the Kennedy Center, after a folk singer and dance group did the same in previous days. The cancellations come after a Trump-appointed board voted to add the current president's name to the building, which was named in memorial for assassinated former president John F. Kennedy.

items.title: Festive dog walk takes over Madrid streets
items.summary_auto: Pups and their humans filled the streets of Madrid on Tuesday for the annual Sanperrestre festive dog walk. The event aims to raise awareness about animal abuse and abandonment, and highlights adopting over buying dogs and cats.

items.title: Health unit in northwestern Ontario confirms measles case, capping a year of alarming rise in Canadian cases
items.summary_auto: The Northwestern Health Unit has confirmed a case of measles in the Kenora area of northwestern Ontario, in a year that saw an alarming rise in cases in Canada and the country lose its measles elimination status.

items.title: Northwestern Health Unit confirms measles case, in a year Canada saw alarming rise in numbers
items.summary_auto: The Northwestern Health Unit has confirmed a case of measles in the Kenora area of northwestern Ontario, in a year that saw an alarming rise in cases in Canada and the country lose its measles elimination status.

items.title: Olympics watchdog failed to close abuse case against gymnastics coach: report
items.summary_auto: A new investigation has found that months before Sean Gardner's arrest on allegations of installing cameras in a girls’ gym bathroom, the American was willing to accept a lifetime ban from coaching gymnastics as part of a deal where he would admit to the abuse, according to three people involved with U.S. SafeSport and its handling of the case.

items.title: Everything you need to know about the latest search for the missing Malaysia Airlines Flight MH370 aircraft
items.summary_auto: A new search for the Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 aircraft is underway, more than 10 years after the Boeing 777's mysterious and baffling disappearance.

items.title: Simu Liu says Hollywood has deemed Asian roles too 'risky' once again
items.summary_auto: The Chinese-born and Toronto-bred actor says Hollywood has backtracked on the diversity improvements it had made in recent years, and is once again treating Asian-led projects as a gamble — despite numerous box office hits with Asian leads proving otherwise. That's why he says the new TV show he's starring in feels rare.

items.title: Despite struggles against U.S., Canadian women’s hockey team remains confident of Olympic gold repeat
items.summary_auto: The United States heaved on the rope in 2025 in its women's hockey tug of war with Canada. Their rivalry is constant, but the stakes rise in the year preceding the Winter Olympics. While Canada has only taken one of eight meetings against its nemesis in 2025, the players remain confident heading into Milan Cortina.

items.title: Why the escalation in Yemen threatens to reignite civil war, create wider tensions
items.summary_auto: The United Arab Emirates said on Tuesday that it was pulling out its remaining forces in Yemen after Saudi Arabia backed a call for the U.A.E. forces to leave the country within 24 hours, in a major crisis between the two Gulf powers and oil producers.

items.title: 1 dead, 3 wounded as RCMP hunt for 2 armed suspects continues on First Nation in Saskatchewan
items.summary_auto: One man is dead and Saskatchewan RCMP say they are still searching for two armed men after an early morning shooting on Big Island Lake Cree Nation.

items.title: Father says son killed as Sask. RCMP search for armed pair on Big Island Lake Cree Nation
items.summary_auto: One man is dead and Saskatchewan RCMP say they are still searching for two armed men after an early morning shooting on Big Island Lake Cree Nation.

items.title: Skier dies after falling into deep snow at Banff resort
items.summary_auto: A 47-year-old woman died on Saturday after falling into deep snow while skiing at Sunshine Village in Banff National Park. She has been transported to Calgary for an autopsy to confirm the cause of death.

items.title: Russia says its negotiating stance on Ukraine will toughen after accusing Kyiv of attack
items.summary_auto: The Kremlin said Tuesday its position would toughen in talks on ending the war in Ukraine after accusing Kyiv of attacking a Russian presidential residence — an allegation that Kyiv said was baseless and intended to prolong the conflict.

items.title: U.S. Coast Guard still in pursuit of sanctioned oil tanker in escalating pressure campaign on Venezuela
U.S. Coast Guard chases Venezuelan oil tanker attempting to claim Russian protection
items.summary_auto: The U.S. Coast Guard is still in pursuit of an oil tanker over a week after they first tried to intercept the ship. U.S. officials said the tanker now has a painted Russian flag on its side in an attempt to draw protection from Moscow. This is the latest in President Trump's pressure campaign on Venezuela after he indicted that the United States has "hit" a dock facility along a shore.

items.title: N.B. Premier Susan Holt doesn’t know why no one knew how to cut gas price sooner
items.summary_auto: Premier says the oversight meant New Brunswickers paid too much for gas during the past few years, as a cheaper form of gasoline became more widely used.

items.title: What's coming up next in Canadian politics? Here are five key stories to watch in 2026
items.summary_auto: 2026 is shaping up to be an action-packed year in Canadian politics. Federal opposition parties will make key decisions on their futures as the Liberal government, just one seat shy of a majority government, strategizes what to do next while juggling U.S. trade talks. Here are five key stories to keep an eye on next year.

items.title: After years on their back foot, here's why Democrats are feeling good about 2026
items.summary_auto: For much of the last two years, the U.S. Democratic Party has been on its back foot, enduring painful electoral defeats to an omnipresent Republican opponent while grappling with a troubling decline in voter registration and a listless party base. But in the closing days of 2025, the political pendulum appears to be swinging in their direction.

items.title: Many Canadians are spending less time with friends. How can we build deeper connections?
items.summary_auto: After tragedy struck their team, the Toronto Dingos turned to a simple weekly tradition — sharing video life updates — creating a culture of connection that experts say highlights why friendship matters more than ever.

items.title: Elbows up in 2025: How a year of Canadian boycotts on U.S. products played out
items.summary_auto: Here are a few of the ways Canadians tried to put more power behind their purchase and travel choices in 2025 — and how those decisions may have impacted the U.S. economy.

items.title: Courthouse canines help ease the tension, one tail wag at a time
items.summary_auto: Therapy dogs and their volunteer handlers from Just Paws are a welcome presence at the Ottawa Courthouse, where the stress can be hard to handle alone.
